Key Match Events: Terceros scored the only goal for Bolivia in the 58th minute.
Miranda received a red card in the 90+3 minute.
Cuellar received a yellow card in the 21st minute.
Castano received a yellow card in the 51st minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Bolivia welcome Colombia to the aptly-named El Alto in their second game at their new home venue in CONMEBOL World Cup qualifying.
Bolivia made the perfect start at their new home, beating Venezuela 4-0 last month.
Colombia recorded a famous win over Argentina in Barranquilla.
Bolivia ended one of the longest competitive winless streaks last month with a historic victory away in Chile.
The appointment of Oscar Villegas was an inspired one, starting with two wins from two.
Colombia are still unbeaten inside 90 minutes under Nestor Lorenzo, who has now taken charge of 28 games.
Colombia avenged their Copa America final defeat by beating Argentina in their last outing.
Colombia are unbeaten in their last 13 meetings with Bolivia, winning 10.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bolivia's new home venue is even higher above sea level than the infamous Estadio Hernando Siles in La Paz.
Bolivia's historic victory away in Chile was their first on the road in qualifying in 67 matches, since a 7-1 win against Venezuela in 1993.
Colombia have won on just two of their last eight visits to Bolivia, with a 4-0 loss in La Paz in 2003 being a particularly low point.
Bolivia have one of the youngest and inexperienced squads in South America.
Colombian supporters were glad to see Luis Diaz kept in reserve by Liverpool at the weekend.
Right-back Daniel Munoz broke down with a muscle issue and has been forced to withdraw.
Captain James Rodriguez is not getting many minutes at Rayo Vallecano, but his levels for Los Cafeteros remain high.
